title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to jmbr
text: outlines propose change jmbr.

title: Contributing to jmbr
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to jmbr
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to jmbr
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. Begin commit merge messages - indicate user facing changes included NEWS.md. use fledge automatically generate NEWS.md file.

title: Contributing to jmbr
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to jmbr
text: Please note jmbr project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with jmbr
text: Thanks using jmbr! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with jmbr
text: opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with jmbr
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: jmbr
text: jmbr (pronounced jimber) R package facilitate analyses using Just Another Gibbs Sampler (JAGS). part mbr family packages.

title: jmbr
text: first part model priors, random effects relationships interest set JAGS. Example model: Priors include mean SD value, converted precision SD^-2. T(0,) Truncates value zero.
code: library(jmbr) library(embr) model <- model("model { # Priors   alpha ~ dnorm(0, 10^-2) T(0,)   beta1 ~ dnorm(0, 10^-2)   beta2 ~ dnorm(0, 10^-2)   beta3 ~ dnorm(0, 10^-2)  # Random Effect   log_sAnnual ~ dnorm(0, 10^-2)   log(sAnnual) <- log_sAnnual   for(i in 1:nAnnual) {     bAnnual[i] ~ dnorm(0, sAnnual^-2)   }  # Prediction of Interest   for (i in 1:length(Pairs)) {     log(ePairs[i]) <- alpha + beta1 * Year[i] + beta2 * Year[i]^2 + beta3 * Year[i]^3 + bAnnual[Annual[i]]     Pairs[i] ~ dpois(ePairs[i])   } }")

title: jmbr
text: new expression written R Code used calculate derived parameters.
code: new_expr = " for (i in 1:length(Pairs)) {   log(prediction[i]) <- alpha + beta1 * Year[i] + beta2 * Year[i]^2 + beta3 * Year[i]^3 + bAnnual[Annual[i]]      fit[i] <- prediction[i]    residual[i] <- res_pois(Pairs[i], fit[i]) }"

title: jmbr
text: section modifies data frame form passed analysis code. modified data passed list form.
code: modify_data = function(data) {  data <- data |>    select(-Eyasses)   data }

title: jmbr
text: Select data named list specifying columns select associated classes values well transformations scaling options. Random effects gets random effects definitions object named list, bAnnual refers column name Annual data. parameters data included model must listed . - values Pairs column outside specified range, including NA’s, error thrown. - "Year*" = 1L indicates Year class integer.
code: select_data = list("Pairs" = c(15L, 200L),                     "Year*" = 1L,                    Annual = factor()), random_effects = list(bAnnual = "Annual"),

title: jmbr
text: Year- = subtracts minimum value (first year) Year+ = subtracts average value (centering) Year* = subtracts average value divides SD (standardizing)

title: jmbr
text: Initial values parameter can set prior analysis single argument function taking modified data returning named list initial values. Unspecified initial values chain drawn prior distributions.
code: gen_inits = function(data) {   inits <-  list()   inits$ePairs <- data$Pairs + 1   inits },

title: jmbr
text: end script thinning rate set, .e. much MCMC chains thinned storing . Setting nthin = 1 corresponds keeping values. Setting nthin = 100 result keeping every 100th value discarding values.

title: jmbr
code: model <- model("model {   alpha ~ dnorm(0, 10^-2)    beta1 ~ dnorm(0, 10^-2)   beta2 ~ dnorm(0, 10^-2)   beta3 ~ dnorm(0, 10^-2)    log_sAnnual ~ dnorm(0, 10^-2)   log(sAnnual) <- log_sAnnual   for(i in 1:nAnnual) {     bAnnual[i] ~ dnorm(0, sAnnual^-2)   }    for (i in 1:length(Pairs)) {     log(ePairs[i]) <- alpha + beta1 * Year[i] + beta2 * Year[i]^2 + beta3 * Year[i]^3 + bAnnual[Annual[i]]     Pairs[i] ~ dpois(ePairs[i])   } }",  new_expr = " for (i in 1:length(Pairs)) {   log(prediction[i]) <- alpha + beta1 * Year[i] + beta2 * Year[i]^2 + beta3 * Year[i]^3 + bAnnual[Annual[i]]      fit[i] <- prediction[i]    residual[i] <- res_pois(Pairs[i], fit[i]) }",  modify_data = function(data) {   data$nObs <- length(data$Annual)   data },  select_data = list("Pairs" = c(15L, 200L),                     "Year*" = 1L,                    Annual = factor()),  random_effects = list(bAnnual = "Annual"),  nthin = 10L) #> Warning: The `x` argument of `model()` character() as of embr 0.0.1.9036. #> ℹ Please use the `code` argument instead. #> ℹ Passing a string to model() is deprecated. Use model(code = ...) or #>   model(mb_code("..."), ...) instead. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated.  data <- bauw::peregrine data$Annual <- factor(data$Year)  set_analysis_mode("report")

title: jmbr
text: Analysis mode can set depending desired output. Modes: Chains = 2L, iterations = 10L, thinning = 1L Chains = 3L, iterations = 500L Chains = 4L, iterations = 1000L

title: jmbr
text: Analyse reanalyse model. Analysis Table: n: Sample size. K: Number parameter terms model. nchains: count number chains. niters: Number iterations. count number simulations save per chain. Measure much independent information autocorrelated chains. Doubling thinning rate doubles ess. Evaluates whether chains agreed values. Close 1 ideal.  Coefficient Table Summary table posterior probability distribution. estimate median default. zscore mean / sd. s-value suprisal value, measure directionality respect zero. s-value zero (unsurprising) p-value = 1.0 increases exponentially p approaches zero. s = -log_2(p-value) Example: surprising throw 10 heads 10 coin tosses. larger s-value provides evidence null hypothesis support data direction posterior.
code: analysis <- analyse(model, data = data) #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'rjags': #>   method               from  #>   as.mcmc.list.mcarray mcmcr #> # A tibble: 1 × 8 #>       n     K nchains niters nthin   ess  rhat converged #>   <int> <int>   <int>  <int> <int> <int> <dbl> <lgl>     #> 1    40     6       3    500    10   204  1.02 TRUE #> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): beep() could not play the sound due to the following error: #> Error in play.default(x, rate, ...): no audio drivers are available analysis <- reanalyse(analysis) #> # A tibble: 1 × 8 #>       n     K nchains niters nthin   ess  rhat converged #>   <int> <int>   <int>  <int> <int> <int> <dbl> <lgl>     #> 1    40     6       3    500    10   204  1.02 TRUE #> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): beep() could not play the sound due to the following error: #> Error in play.default(x, rate, ...): no audio drivers are available par(mar=c(1, 1, 1, 1)) plot(analysis) coef(analysis) #> Warning: The `simplify` argument of `coef()` must be TRUE as of mcmcr 0.4.1. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the base package. #>   Please report the issue to the authors. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated. #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   term        estimate     sd  zscore   lower   upper   pvalue #>   <term>         <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 alpha         4.26   0.0386 110.     4.18    4.34   0.000666 #> 2 beta1         1.20   0.0757  15.9    1.06    1.37   0.000666 #> 3 beta2        -0.0179 0.0298  -0.599 -0.0760  0.0405 0.506    #> 4 beta3        -0.274  0.0389  -7.11  -0.360  -0.209  0.000666 #> 5 log_sAnnual  -2.23   0.317   -7.15  -3.03   -1.75   0.000666 #> 6 sAnnual       0.108  0.0311   3.49   0.0481  0.174  0.000666 coef(analysis, simplify = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   term        estimate   lower   upper svalue #>   <term>         <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 alpha         4.26    4.18    4.34   10.6   #> 2 beta1         1.20    1.06    1.37   10.6   #> 3 beta2        -0.0179 -0.0760  0.0405  0.984 #> 4 beta3        -0.274  -0.360  -0.209  10.6   #> 5 log_sAnnual  -2.23   -3.03   -1.75   10.6   #> 6 sAnnual       0.108   0.0481  0.174  10.6

title: jmbr
text: Example prediction: Make predictions varying Year predictors, including random effect Annual held constant.
code: year <- predict(analysis, new_data = "Year") #> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): beep() could not play the sound due to the following error: #> Error in play.default(x, rate, ...): no audio drivers are available  library(ggplot2)  ggplot(data = year, aes(x = Year, y = estimate)) +   geom_point(data = bauw::peregrine, aes(y = Pairs)) +   geom_line() +   geom_line(aes(y = lower), linetype = "dotted") +   geom_line(aes(y = upper), linetype = "dotted") +   expand_limits(y = 0)

title: jmbr
text: Predict() queries model tells expected number combination values specified new data. example calculate annual number pairs typical number fledged young 50 (Eyasses parameter model). Arguments new_data: Creates new data frame calculate predictions . allows calculate average change relative something else. case ref = list(Eyasses = 50L). Predict can also take form: term calls string term new expression model. default prediction[].
code: year <- new_data(data, "Year", ref = list(Eyasses = 50L),                  obs_only = TRUE) %>%         predict(analysis, new_data = ., ref_data = ref) year <- predict(analysis, new_data = character(0), term = "ePairs")

title: jmbr
text: Creates new data frame passed predict function. idea variables held constant reference level variables interest vary across range. Arguments factor named seq levels factor represented. case, holding column Eyasses constant 50L. obs_only = TRUE obs_only set seq. factor named seq levels factor represented (length_out ignored). exception factor named obs_only, observed factor levels represented sequences.
code: year <- new_data(       data,        seq = "Year",        ref = list(Eyasses = 50L),        obs_only = TRUE) %>%   predict(analysis, new_data = ., ref_data = ref)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Joe Thorley (2018) jmbr: Analyses Using JAGS. doi: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.1162355.
code: @Misc{,   author = {Joe Thorley},   year = {2018},   title = {jmbr: Analyses Using JAGS},   doi = {https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.1162355}, }

title: Analyses Using JAGS
text: jmbr (pronounced jimber) R package facilitate analyses using Just Another Gibbs Sampler (JAGS). part mbr family packages.

title: Analyses Using JAGS
code: library(jmbr) library(mbr) # define model in JAGS language model <- model("model {   alpha ~ dnorm(0, 10^-2)   beta1 ~ dnorm(0, 10^-2)   beta2 ~ dnorm(0, 10^-2)   beta3 ~ dnorm(0, 10^-2)    log_sAnnual ~ dnorm(0, 10^-2)   log(sAnnual) <- log_sAnnual    for(i in 1:nAnnual) {     bAnnual[i] ~ dnorm(0, sAnnual^-2)   }    for (i in 1:length(Pairs)) {     log(ePairs[i]) <- alpha + beta1 * Year[i] + beta2 * Year[i]^2 + beta3 * Year[i]^3 + bAnnual[Annual[i]]     Pairs[i] ~ dpois(ePairs[i])   } }")  # add R code to calculate derived parameters model <- update_model(model, new_expr = " for (i in 1:length(Pairs)) {   log(prediction[i]) <- alpha + beta1 * Year[i] + beta2 * Year[i]^2 + beta3 * Year[i]^3 + bAnnual[Annual[i]] }")  # define data types and center year model <- update_model(model,    select_data = list("Pairs" = integer(), "Year*" = integer(), Annual = factor()),   derived = "sAnnual",   random_effects = list(bAnnual = "Annual"))  data <- bauw::peregrine data$Annual <- factor(data$Year)  set_analysis_mode("report")  # analyse analysis <- analyse(model, data = data) #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'rjags': #>   method               from  #>   as.mcmc.list.mcarray mcmcr #> # A tibble: 1 × 8 #>       n     K nchains niters nthin   ess  rhat converged #>   <int> <int>   <int>  <int> <int> <int> <dbl> <lgl>     #> 1    40     5       3    500     1     9  5.11 FALSE analysis <- reanalyse(analysis) #> # A tibble: 1 × 8 #>       n     K nchains niters nthin   ess  rhat converged #>   <int> <int>   <int>  <int> <int> <int> <dbl> <lgl>     #> 1    40     5       3    500     2    44  3.47 FALSE  coef(analysis, simplify = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 5 × 5 #>   term        estimate  lower upper svalue #>   <term>         <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 alpha         4.25    3.05  4.35  10.6   #> 2 beta1         1.16   -1.13  1.33   1.55  #> 3 beta2        -0.0160 -0.205 0.419  0.520 #> 4 beta3        -0.254  -0.338 0.768  1.35  #> 5 log_sAnnual  -2.10   -2.82  0.366  1.78  plot(analysis) # make predictions by varying year with other predictors including the random effect of Annual held constant year <- predict(analysis, new_data = "Year")  # plot those predictions library(ggplot2)  ggplot(data = year, aes(x = Year, y = estimate)) +   geom_point(data = bauw::peregrine, aes(y = Pairs)) +   geom_line() +   geom_line(aes(y = lower), linetype = "dotted") +   geom_line(aes(y = upper), linetype = "dotted") +   expand_limits(y = 0)
